options: There is someone who everyone loves
hint: Read left to right: For ALL x, there EXISTS a y such that x loves y.
explanation: ∀x∃y(Loves(x,y)): For every person x, there's some person y that x loves. Each person might love a different person. Compare to ∃y∀x(Loves(x,y)): There's ONE person y that everyone loves (same person).
visual_concept: ∀∃: Every arrow starts from a different source, each pointing to some target. ∃∀: All arrows point to the same single target.
